comments:
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError when launching a manual test with security enabled.

When launching a manual test (local or remote) using the TPTP-4.2.1-200609071820C driver (local and remote) with security enabled, the following exception is thrown:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

JRE (client and server):

Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32devifx-20060124)
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223ifx-2006
0124 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20051027_03723_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20051027_1437_r8
GC   - 20051020_AA)
JCL  - 20060120
Assigning it to Samson - this is RAC/Hyades Execution framework related
Is this a regression since TPTP-4.2.1-200609071820B?

(In reply to comment #3)
> Is this a regression since TPTP-4.2.1-200609071820B?

We did not run the security tests with the B driver (only the A driver).
Did all test pass on the "A" driver?
Joe, does this sound right?

I cannot reproduce this with the same driver.  (It works for me.)

I'm working with Paul to try to narrow down the problem.

(In reply to comment #5)
> Did all test pass on the "A" driver?

Yes.

Appears to be a JRE issue since running with the below IBM 5 SR2 JRE works for the local and remote scenarios:

java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32dev-20060511 (SR2))

IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223-2006050
4 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20060501_06428_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20060428_1800_r8
GC   - 20060501_AA)
JCL  - 20060511a

After re-testing with the original JRE on the same machines, I cannot reproduce this defect.

Returning as 'works for me' under we can reproduce the defect consistently.

It seems to be related to the following:
- File transfer service
- JVM being used
- possible java.nio incompatibility with JSSE

Paul, can you use an official IBM JRE 1.5 SR3?

(In reply to comment #11)

Windows XP (local)

(In reply to comment #12)
> It seems to be related to the following:
> - File transfer service
> - JVM being used
> - possible java.nio incompatibility with JSSE
> Paul, can you use an official IBM JRE 1.5 SR3?

Using the following JRE, test execution works:

java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32dev-20061002a (SR3)
)
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows XP x86-32 j9vmwi3223-2006100
1 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20060915_08260_lHdSMR
JIT  - 20060908_1811_r8
GC   - 20060906_AA)
JCL  - 20061002
From the comment histories, the exception only occurs if a non-GA IBM JRE is used on the client side. When using the GA versions (SR2 or SR3) then test execution works.

After re-testing with the IBM 1.5 SR3 JRE on the same machines, I cannot reproduce this defect.

Closing.

(In reply to comment #16)
> After re-testing with the IBM 1.5 SR3 JRE on the same machines, I cannot
> reproduce this defect.
> Closing.

"the same machines" --> "both machines"

I would like to revisit this problem in 4.4 since I did experience one OutOfMemoryError while testing the TPTP-4.3.0-200611160100 driver during 4.3 i3 TP2 (local Windows XP test execution):

Given all the comments on this bugzilla with speculation that the problem is related to the JREs in use, I suggest that anytime this problem is experienced, the user should record the JREs in use by both the workbench and the agent controller.  At least then we can start to gather some data, and either conclude that it's an intermittent problem that occurs across all JREs, or that it's related to a specific JRE.

(In reply to comment #19)
